intro: Polycarena calva, commonly known as the common water clover, is a species of flowering plant in the family Geraniaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, often near water bodies. The plant has distinctive, trifoliate leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern, and it produces small, pink to purple flowers. It is characterized by its ability to thrive in moist environments and is often found in temperate regions. Polycarena calva plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various small organisms.
